title: Three Dead Three Injured in Pawtucket Hockey Game Shooting
snippets: Two people were killed and three others were injured at a shooting at a high school hockey game in Pawtucket.

Shooting at hockey game in Pawtucket that left three dead and three injured may have also been a ‘targeted event’ The shooting at a Rhode Island high school hockey game that left three dead and three injured may have been a “targeted event” stemming from a “family dispute,” officials have said, with

Three people, including the suspect, were killed in a shooting during a Rhode Island youth hockey game. Three others are in critical condition. Police say it appears targeted and possibly tied to a family dispute.
Investigators had spoken to nearly 100 witnesses as of Monday evening as they attempt to piece together what happened inside the Dennis M. Lynch Arena in Pawtucket.

Police believe the incident was targeted and may be linked to a family dispute. A good Samaritan helped stop the shooting, and investigators have interviewed nearly 100 witnesses.

title: Czechia to Face Canada in Olympic Hockey Quarterfinal After Win Over
snippets: Heading into the knockout round, here's who has over- or underperformed for their nation.

Canada now knows its opponent for the knockout stage of the men’s Olympic hockey tournament. Czechia has booked its spot in the quarterfinals after a 3-2 win over Denmark on Tuesday at Milano Cortina 2026. Martin Necas had a goal and an assist, while captain Roman Cervenka had the deciding goal to lead his country to another showdown against Canada. Lukas Dostal made 24 saves for his third win at the Olympics. Denmark put up a good fight with Nick Olesen and Alexander True scoring, and Frederik Andersen made 31 saves in the loss. It will be the first Canada-Czechia men’s hockey playoff game...

Czechia knows what to expect playing Canada at the Olympics but this time around, they’re hoping for a better outcome with the stakes at an all-time high. Once again, Czechia will face the hockey powerhouse in the quarterfinals of the men’s Olympic tournament, eying a better result than the 5-0 thrashing they received in the opener. title: Italy and Canada Win Team Pursuit Speed Skating Gold at 2026 Olympics
snippets: Watch as speed skating trio Ivanie Blondin, Isabelle Weidemann and Valérie Maltais receive their gold medals for their victory at the women’s team pursuit event, bringing Canada’s gold medal total up to three at the 2026 Olympics.

Watch as Canada wins its third gold medal at the 2026 Winter Olympics, as the trio of Isabelle Weidemann, Valérie Maltais and Ivanie Blondin defeat the Netherlands in women’s long-track team pursuit speed skating.

MILAN (AP) — The U.S. men’s team pursuit trio of Casey Dawson , Emery Lehman and Ethan Cepuran dominated that speedskating event lately. They are the reigning world champions and world record-holders. They won five World Cup titles. They came to the Milan Cortina Olympics in search of just one thing: the gold medal. They'll leave with the silver, though, because they could not keep up with Italy’s Davide Ghiotto, Andrea Giovannini and Michele Malfatti and lost to them twice at these Winter Games, including by 4 1/2 seconds in the final on Tuesday. title: NASA Image Reveals Heavy Snow Cover Across Hokkaido in February 2026
snippets: Northern Japan, especially the island of Hokkaido, is home to some of the snowiest cities in the world. Sapporo, the island's largest city and host of an annual snow festival, typically sees more than 140 days of snowfall, with nearly 6 meters (20 feet) accumulating on average each year.

On February 5, 2026, the MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) on NASA’s Terra satellite acquired this image of snow-covered landscapes across Hokkaido.
